documentation.text:
These are features to implement a safe exchange in another
 contract inheriting this one.
This event is raised when a new deal is created.
This event is raised when a deal is accepted by the receiver.

This event is raised when a deal is confirmed by its creator,
 after the receiver's acceptance.

This event is raised when a deal is broken by its emitter, the
 receiver, or an operator on behalf of any of them.
All the ACTIVE / PENDING deals instantiated so far.

documentation.text:
Starting a deal requires the sender to be the _emitter address
 or an address the sender can operate on their behalf. Also, the
 objects data must be non-empty, and no element must be 0.

arguments.value: SafeExchange: invalid deal

documentation.text:
Accepting a deal requires the deal to be valid, the sender to
 be the deal receiver (or an allowed operator of the deal receiver),
 and the deal to be in the appropriate state. Also, the objects data
 must be non-empty and no element must be 0.

arguments.value: SafeExchange: invalid deal

documentation.text:
Confirming a deal requires the deal to be valid, the sender to
 be the deal emitter (or an allowed operator of the deal emitter),
 and the deal to be in the appropriate state.

arguments.value: SafeExchange: invalid deal

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "SafeExchange: caller is not emitter/receiver nor approved"

arguments.value: SafeExchange: caller is not emitter/receiver nor approved

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "SafeExchange: caller is not emitter/receiver nor approved"

documentation.text:
Breaking a deal requires the deal to be valid, the sender to be
 the emitter (or approved) or the receiver (or approved).

Tells whether a sender is approved for a given party
 to perform this contract's operations on their behalf.
Does a batch transfer of the tokens from one party to the other.

These are features to implement a safe exchange in another
 contract inheriting this one.
This event is raised when a new deal is created.
This event is raised when a deal is accepted by the receiver.

This event is raised when a deal is confirmed by its creator,
 after the receiver's acceptance.

This event is raised when a deal is broken by its emitter, the
 receiver, or an operator on behalf of any of them.
All the ACTIVE / PENDING deals instantiated so far.

documentation.text:
Breaking a deal requires the deal to be valid, the sender to be
 the emitter (or approved) or the receiver (or approved).

Tells whether a sender is approved for a given party
 to perform this contract's operations on their behalf.
Does a batch transfer of the tokens from one party to the other.

DealAccepted(uint256,address,address,uin.notice: This event is raised when a deal is accepted by the receiver.

DealBroken(uint256,address).notice: This event is raised when a deal is broken by its emitter, the receiver, or an operator on behalf of any of them.

DealConfirmed(uint256,address,address).notice: This event is raised when a deal is confirmed by its creator, after the receiver's acceptance.

DealStarted(uint256,address,address,uint.notice: This event is raised when a new deal is created.

dealAccept(uint256,uint256[],uint256[]).notice: Accepting a deal requires the deal to be valid, the sender to be the deal receiver (or an allowed operator of the deal receiver), and the deal to be in the appropriate state. Also, the objects data must be non-empty and no element must be 0.

dealBreak(uint256).notice: Breaking a deal requires the deal to be valid, the sender to be the emitter (or approved) or the receiver (or approved).

dealConfirm(uint256).notice: Confirming a deal requires the deal to be valid, the sender to be the deal emitter (or an allowed operator of the deal emitter), and the deal to be in the appropriate state.

dealStart(address,address,uint256[],uint.notice: Starting a deal requires the sender to be the _emitter address or an address the sender can operate on their behalf. Also, the objects data must be non-empty, and no element must be 0.

deals(uint256).notice: All the ACTIVE / PENDING deals instantiated so far.

userdoc.notice: These are features to implement a safe exchange in another contract inheriting this one.
